title: Trend Recognition
content: Trends reveal direction and rate of change. A single reading is a snapshot; multiple readings over time are a trend. Stable readings mean static conditions. Rising or falling readings indicate change. The rate of change tells you how much time you have. Always think in trends, not snapshots.

mcq.question: Temperature reads 160°F. Five minutes ago it was 155°F. Ten minutes ago it was 150°F. What does the trend tell you?

options.B: Temperature is rising at 1°F per minute and will continue unless something changes

mcq.explanation: The trend shows consistent rise at 1°F/minute. This allows projection: if the limit is 180°F, you have approximately 20 minutes unless you intervene.

openQuestions: Do your monitoring systems display trends or just current values? How does this affect your SA?
